      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Demographics">Demographics</span></h2> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Pakistan" title="Demographics of Pakistan">Demographics of Pakistan</a>, <a href="/wiki/Demographic_history_of_Pakistan" title="Demographic history of Pakistan">Demographic history of Pakistan</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ethnic_groups_in_Pakistan" title="Ethnic groups in Pakistan">Ethnic groups in Pakistan</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Pakistanis" title="Pakistanis">Pakistanis</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Pakistan_population_density.png" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8e/Pakistan_population_density.png/220px-Pakistan_population_density.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="206" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8e/Pakistan_population_density.png/330px-Pakistan_population_density.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8e/Pakistan_population_density.png/440px-Pakistan_population_density.png 2x" data-file-width="5400" data-file-height="5056"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Pakistan_population_density.png" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>Map showing population density in Pakistan, per the 2017 census.<sup id="cite_ref-506" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-506">[502]</a></sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>As of 2020, Pakistan is the fifth <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_population" title="List of countries and dependencies by population">most populous</a> country in the world and accounts for about 2.8% of the <a href="/wiki/World_population" title="World population">world population</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-World_Meters_507-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-World_Meters-507">[503]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/2017_Census_of_Pakistan" title="2017 Census of Pakistan">2017 Census of Pakistan</a> provisionally estimated the population to be 207.8&nbsp;million.<sup id="cite_ref-population_508-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-population-508">[504]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-509" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-509">[505]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-USCB_510-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-USCB-510">[506]</a></sup> This figure excludes data from <a href="/wiki/Gilgit-Baltistan" title="Gilgit-Baltistan">Gilgit-Baltistan</a> and <a href="/wiki/Azad_Kashmir" title="Azad Kashmir">Azad Kashmir</a>, which is likely to be included in the final report.<sup id="cite_ref-511" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-511">[507]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The population in 2017 represents a 57% increase from 1998.<sup id="cite_ref-population_508-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-population-508">[504]</a></sup> The annual growth rate in 2016 was reported to be 1.45%, which is the highest of the <a href="/wiki/South_Asian_Association_for_Regional_Cooperation" title="South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation">SAARC nations</a>, though the growth rate has been decreasing in recent years.<sup id="cite_ref-cia.gov_512-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cia.gov-512">[508]</a></sup> The population is projected to reach 263&nbsp;million by 2030.<sup id="cite_ref-World_Meters_507-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-World_Meters-507">[503]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>At the time of the <a href="/wiki/Partition_of_India" title="Partition of India">partition</a> in 1947, Pakistan had a population of 32.5&nbsp;million;<sup id="cite_ref-young_373-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-young-373">[369]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-popu1_513-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-popu1-513">[509]</a></sup> the population increased by ~57.2% between the years <a href="/wiki/Fiscal_year" title="Fiscal year">1990 and 2009</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-514" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-514">[510]</a></sup> By 2030 Pakistan is expected to surpass Indonesia as the largest Muslim-majority country in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-515" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-515">[511]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-516" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-516">[512]</a></sup> Pakistan is classified as a "young nation", with a median age of 23.4 in 2016;<sup id="cite_ref-cia.gov_512-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cia.gov-512">[508]</a></sup> about 104&nbsp;million people were under the age of 30 in 2010. In 2016 Pakistan's fertility rate was estimated to be 2.68,<sup id="cite_ref-cia.gov_512-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cia.gov-512">[508]</a></sup> higher than its neighbour India (2.45).<sup id="cite_ref-517" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-517">[513]</a></sup> Around 35% of the people are under 15.<sup id="cite_ref-young_373-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-young-373">[369]</a></sup> The vast majority of those residing in <a href="/wiki/Southern_Pakistan" class="mw-redirect" title="Southern Pakistan">southern Pakistan</a> live along the <a href="/wiki/Indus_River" title="Indus River">Indus River</a>, with <a href="/wiki/Karachi" title="Karachi">Karachi</a> being the most populous commercial city in the south.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Urban_FrontierâKarachi_518-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Urban_FrontierâKarachi-518">[514]</a></sup> In eastern, <a href="/wiki/Khyber_Pakhtunkhwa" title="Khyber Pakhtunkhwa">western</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Northern_Pakistan" class="mw-redirect" title="Northern Pakistan">northern Pakistan</a>, most of the population lives in an arc formed by the cities of <a href="/wiki/Lahore" title="Lahore">Lahore</a>, <a href="/wiki/Faisalabad" title="Faisalabad">Faisalabad</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rawalpindi" title="Rawalpindi">Rawalpindi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sargodha" title="Sargodha">Sargodha</a>, Islamabad, <a href="/wiki/Gujranwala" title="Gujranwala">Gujranwala</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sialkot" title="Sialkot">Sialkot</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gujrat_city" class="mw-redirect" title="Gujrat city">Gujrat</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jhelum" title="Jhelum">Jhelum</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sheikhupura" title="Sheikhupura">Sheikhupura</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nowshera,_Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa" class="mw-redirect" title="Nowshera, Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa">Nowshera</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mardan" title="Mardan">Mardan</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Peshawar" title="Peshawar">Peshawar</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-ciafactbook_186-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ciafactbook-186">[182]</a></sup> During <a href="/wiki/Fiscal_year" title="Fiscal year">1990â2008</a>, city dwellers made up 36% of Pakistan's population, making it the <a href="/wiki/Urbanisation_in_Pakistan" title="Urbanisation in Pakistan">most urbanised nation</a> in South Asia, which increased to 38% by 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-ciafactbook_186-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ciafactbook-186">[182]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-young_373-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-young-373">[369]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-who.int_519-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-who.int-519">[515]</a></sup> Furthermore, 50% of Pakistanis live in towns of 5,000 people or more.<sup id="cite_ref-Jason_Burke_520-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jason_Burke-520">[516]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Expenditure on healthcare was ~2.8% of GDP in 2013. Life expectancy at birth was 67 years for females and 65 years for males in 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-who.int_519-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-who.int-519">[515]</a></sup> The private sector accounts for about 80% of outpatient visits. Approximately 19% of the population and 30% of children under five are malnourished.<sup id="cite_ref-raid_349-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-raid-349">[345]</a></sup> Mortality of the under-fives was 86 per 1,000 live births in 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-who.int_519-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-who.int-519">[515]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Languages">Languages</span></h3> 
      <div class="barbox tright" style="overflow-x: auto;"> 
       <div style="border:1px solid silver; font-size:88%; padding:0.4em; width:auto; background: white;"> 
        <table style="text-align:left; border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;"> 
         <tbody>
          <tr style="background:none">
           <th style="text-align:center;" colspan="5">First languages of Pakistan<sup id="cite_ref-2017_Census_521-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2017_Census-521">[517]</a></sup></th>
          </tr> 
          <tr style="font-size:88%; height:4px;"> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding:0 4px; text-align:left;"></td> 
           <td style="width:100px; text-align:left;"></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding:0 4px; width:1em; text-align:right;"></td> 
          </tr> 
          <tr> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Punjabi_language" title="Punjabi language">Punjabi</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:DarkSlateGray; width:38.78%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">38.78%</td> 
          </tr>

           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Pashto_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Pashto language">Pashto</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:DarkSlateGray; width:18.24%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">18.24%</td> 
          </tr> 
          <tr> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Sindhi_language" title="Sindhi language">Sindhi</a></td>

            <div style="background:DarkSlateGray; width:14.57%; overflow: hidden;">

           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Saraiki_language" title="Saraiki language">Saraiki</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:DarkSlateGray; width:12.19%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">12.19%</td> 
          </tr> 
          <tr> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Urdu_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Urdu language">Urdu</a></td>

            <div style="background:DarkSlateGray; width:7.08%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">7.08%</td>

           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Languages_of_Pakistan" title="Languages of Pakistan">others</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:DarkSlateGray; width:6.12%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">6.12%</td> 
          </tr> 
         </tbody>
        </table> 
       </div> 
      </div> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_Pakistan" title="Languages of Pakistan">Languages of Pakistan</a>
      </div> 
      <p>More than sixty languages are spoken in Pakistan, including a number of <a href="/wiki/Provincial_languages_of_Pakistan" title="Provincial languages of Pakistan">provincial languages</a>. <a href="/wiki/Urdu" title="Urdu">Urdu</a>âthe <i><a href="/wiki/Lingua_franca" title="Lingua franca">lingua franca</a></i> and a symbol of <a href="/wiki/Muslim_nationalism_in_South_Asia" title="Muslim nationalism in South Asia">Muslim identity</a> and national unityâis the national language understood by over 75% of Pakistanis. It is the main medium of communication in the country but the primary language of only 7% of Pakistan's population.<sup id="cite_ref-2017_Census_521-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2017_Census-521">[517]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-National_language_522-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-National_language-522">[518]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-UrduOfficial?_523-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-UrduOfficial?-523">[519]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Urdu" title="Urdu">Urdu</a> and English are the <a href="/wiki/Official_language" title="Official language">official languages</a> of Pakistan, with English primarily used in official business and government, and in legal contracts;<sup id="cite_ref-ciafactbook_186-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ciafactbook-186">[182]</a></sup> the local variety is known as <a href="/wiki/Pakistani_English" title="Pakistani English">Pakistani English</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Punjabi_language" title="Punjabi language">Punjabi language</a>, the most common in Pakistan and the <a href="/wiki/First_language" title="First language">first language</a> of 38.78% of Pakistan's population,<sup id="cite_ref-2017_Census_521-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2017_Census-521">[517]</a></sup> is mostly spoken in the Punjab. <a href="/wiki/Saraiki_language" title="Saraiki language">Saraiki</a> is mainly spoken in South Punjab, and <a href="/wiki/Hindko" title="Hindko">Hindko</a> is predominant in the <a href="/wiki/Hazara_region" class="mw-redirect" title="Hazara region">Hazara region</a> of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. <a href="/wiki/Pashto" title="Pashto">Pashto</a> is the provincial language of <a href="/wiki/Khyber_Pakhtunkhwa" title="Khyber Pakhtunkhwa">Khyber Pakhtunkhwa</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Sindhi_language" title="Sindhi language">Sindhi language</a> is commonly spoken in Sindh, while the <a href="/wiki/Balochi_language" title="Balochi language">Balochi language</a> is dominant in Balochistan. <a href="/wiki/Brahui_language" title="Brahui language">Brahui</a>, a Dravidian language, is spoken by the <a href="/wiki/Brahui_people" title="Brahui people">Brahui people</a> who live in Balochistan.<sup id="cite_ref-:14_524-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:14-524">[520]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-britishcouncil.org_525-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-britishcouncil.org-525">[521]</a></sup> There are also speakers of <a href="/wiki/Gujarati_language" title="Gujarati language">Gujarati</a> in Karachi.<sup id="cite_ref-:72_526-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:72-526">[522]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Marwari_language" title="Marwari language">Marwari</a>, a Rajasthani language, is also spoken in parts of Sindh. Various languages such as <a href="/wiki/Shina_language" title="Shina language">Shina</a>, <a href="/wiki/Balti_language" title="Balti language">Balti</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Burushaski" title="Burushaski">Burushaski</a> are spoken in <a href="/wiki/Gilgit-Baltistan" title="Gilgit-Baltistan">Gilgit-Baltistan</a>, whilst languages such as <a href="/wiki/Pahari_language_(Azad_Kashmir)" class="mw-redirect" title="Pahari language (Azad Kashmir)">Pahari</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gojri_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Gojri language">Gojri</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Kashmiri_language" title="Kashmiri language">Kashmiri</a> are spoken by many in <a href="/wiki/Azad_Kashmir" title="Azad Kashmir">Azad Kashmir</a>. </p>
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Arabic" title="Arabic">Arabic</a> language is officially recognised by the <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Pakistan" title="Constitution of Pakistan">constitution of Pakistan</a>. It declares in article 31 No. 2 that <i>"The State shall endeavour, as respects the <a href="/wiki/Muslim" class="mw-redirect" title="Muslim">Muslims</a> of Pakistan (a) to make the teaching of the <a href="/wiki/Quran" title="Quran">Holy Quran</a> and <a href="/wiki/Islamic_studies" title="Islamic studies">Islamiat</a> compulsory, to encourage and facilitate the learning of Arabic language ..."</i><sup id="cite_ref-CP/31_527-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CP/31-527">[523]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Immigration">Immigration</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Immigration_to_Pakistan" title="Immigration to Pakistan">Immigration to Pakistan</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Tarbela_Dam_Area.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Tarbela_Dam_Area.JPG/220px-Tarbela_Dam_Area.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Tarbela_Dam_Area.JPG/330px-Tarbela_Dam_Area.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Tarbela_Dam_Area.JPG/440px-Tarbela_Dam_Area.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="1200"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Tarbela_Dam_Area.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>Pakistan hosts the second largest refugee population globally after Turkey.<sup id="cite_ref-528" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-528">[524]</a></sup> An Afghan refugee girl near <a href="/wiki/Tarbela_Dam" title="Tarbela Dam">Tarbela Dam</a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Even after partition in 1947, Indian Muslims continued to migrate to Pakistan throughout the 1950s and 1960s, and these migrants settled mainly in Karachi and other towns of Sindh province.<sup id="cite_ref-529" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-529">[525]</a></sup> The wars in neighboring Afghanistan during the 1980s and 1990s also forced millions of <a href="/wiki/Afghan_refugees" title="Afghan refugees">Afghan refugees</a> into Pakistan. The <a href="/wiki/Census_in_Pakistan" title="Census in Pakistan">Pakistan Census</a> excludes the 1.41&nbsp;million registered <a href="/wiki/Afghans_in_Pakistan" title="Afghans in Pakistan">refugees from Afghanistan</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Factsheet_Pakistan_March_2017_530-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Factsheet_Pakistan_March_2017-530">[526]</a></sup> who are found mainly in the <a href="/wiki/Khyber_Pakhtunkhwa" title="Khyber Pakhtunkhwa">Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa</a> and <a href="/wiki/Federally_Administered_Tribal_Areas" title="Federally Administered Tribal Areas">tribal belt</a>, with small numbers residing in <a href="/wiki/Karachi" title="Karachi">Karachi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Quetta" title="Quetta">Quetta</a>. Pakistan is home to one of the world's largest <a href="/wiki/Refugee" title="Refugee">refugee</a> populations.<sup id="cite_ref-531" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-531">[527]</a></sup> In addition to Afghans, around 2&nbsp;million <a href="/wiki/Bangladeshis_in_Pakistan" class="mw-redirect" title="Bangladeshis in Pakistan">Bangladeshis</a> and half a million other undocumented people live in Pakistan. They are claimed to be from other areas such as <a href="/wiki/Myanmar" title="Myanmar">Myanmar</a>, Iran, Iraq, and Africa.<sup id="cite_ref-532" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-532">[528]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Experts say that the migration of both Bengalis and Burmese (<a href="/wiki/Rohingya_people" title="Rohingya people">Rohingya</a>) to Pakistan started in the 1980s and continued until 1998. Shaikh Muhammad Feroze, the chairman of the Pakistani Bengali Action Committee, claims that there are 200 settlements of Bengali-speaking people in Pakistan, of which 132 are in Karachi. They are also found in various other areas of Pakistan such as Thatta, Badin, Hyderabad, Tando Adam, and Lahore.<sup id="cite_ref-533" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-533">[529]</a></sup> Large-scale Rohingya migration to Karachi made that city one of the largest population centres of Rohingyas in the world after Myanmar.<sup id="cite_ref-534" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-534">[530]</a></sup> The Burmese community of Karachi is spread out over 60 of the city's slums such as the Burmi Colony in Korangi, Arakanabad, Machchar colony, Bilal colony, Ziaul Haq Colony, and Godhra Camp.<sup id="cite_ref-535" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-535">[531]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Thousands of <a href="/wiki/Uyghurs" title="Uyghurs">Uyghur</a> Muslims have also migrated to the Gilgit-Baltistan region of Pakistan, fleeing religious and cultural persecution in Xinjiang, China.<sup id="cite_ref-536" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-536">[532]</a></sup> Since 1989 thousands of <a href="/wiki/Kashmiris" title="Kashmiris">Kashmiri</a> Muslim refugees have sought refuge in Pakistan, complaining that many of the refugee women had been raped by Indian soldiers and that they were forced out of their homes by the soldiers.<sup id="cite_ref-537" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-537">[533]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Ethnic_groups">Ethnic groups</span></h3> 
      <div class="barbox tright" style="overflow-x: auto;"> 
       <div style="border:1px solid silver; font-size:88%; padding:0.4em; width:auto; background: white;"> 
        <table style="text-align:left; border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;"> 
         <tbody>
          <tr style="background:#ddd">
           <th style="text-align:center;" colspan="5"><a href="/wiki/Ethnic_groups_in_Pakistan" title="Ethnic groups in Pakistan">Ethnic groups in Pakistan</a><sup id="cite_ref-cia_3-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cia-3">[3]</a></sup></th>
          </tr> 
          <tr style="font-size:88%; height:4px;"> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding:0 4px; text-align:left;"></td> 
           <td style="width:100px; text-align:left;"></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding:0 4px; width:1em; text-align:right;"></td> 
          </tr> 
          <tr> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Punjabis" title="Punjabis">Punjabi</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:green; width:44.7%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">44.7%</td>

            <div style="background:blue; width:15.4%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">15.4%</td> 
          </tr> 
          <tr> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Sindhis" title="Sindhis">Sindhi</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:red; width:14.1%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">14.1%</td> 
          </tr> 
          <tr> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Saraiki_people" title="Saraiki people">Saraiki</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:pink; width:8.4%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">8.4%</td> 
          </tr> 
          <tr> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Muhajir_people" title="Muhajir people">Muhajir</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:yellow; width:7.6%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">7.6%</td> 
          </tr> 
          <tr> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Balochis" class="mw-redirect" title="Balochis">Baloch</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:cyan; width:3.6%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">3.6%</td> 
          </tr> 
          <tr> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Ethnic_groups_in_Pakistan" title="Ethnic groups in Pakistan">others</a></td> 
           <td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">
            <div style="background:orange; width:6.3%; overflow: hidden;">
             â
            </div></td> 
           <td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">6.3%</td> 
          </tr> 
         </tbody>
        </table> 
       </div> 
      </div> 
      <p>The major ethnic groups are <a href="/wiki/Punjabi_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Punjabi people">Punjabis</a> (44.7% of the country's population), <a href="/wiki/Pashtuns" title="Pashtuns">Pashtuns</a>, also known as Pathans (15.4%), <a href="/wiki/Sindhi_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Sindhi people">Sindhis</a> (14.1%), <a href="/wiki/Saraiki_people" title="Saraiki people">Saraikis</a> (8.4%), <a href="/wiki/Muhajir_(Pakistan)" class="mw-redirect" title="Muhajir (Pakistan)">Muhajirs</a> (the <a href="/wiki/Indian_Muslims_in_Pakistan" class="mw-redirect" title="Indian Muslims in Pakistan">Indian emigrants</a>, mostly Urdu-speaking), who make up 7.6% of the population, and the <a href="/wiki/Baloch_people" title="Baloch people">Baloch</a> with 3.6%.<sup id="cite_ref-cia_3-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cia-3">[3]</a></sup> The remaining 6.3% consist of a number of ethnic minorities such as the <a href="/wiki/Brahui_people" title="Brahui people">Brahuis</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-:14_524-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:14-524">[520]</a></sup> the <a href="/wiki/Hindkowans" title="Hindkowans">Hindkowans</a>, the various peoples of Gilgit-Baltistan, the <a href="/wiki/Kashmiris" title="Kashmiris">Kashmiris</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Siddi" title="Siddi">Sheedis</a> (who are of African descent),<sup id="cite_ref-538" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-538">[534]</a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/Hazara_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Hazara people">Hazaras</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Brookings_population_2010_539-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brookings_population_2010-539">[535]</a></sup> There is also a large <a href="/wiki/Pakistani_diaspora" class="mw-redirect" title="Pakistani diaspora">Pakistani diaspora</a> worldwide, numbering over seven million,<sup id="cite_ref-diaspora_540-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-diaspora-540">[536]</a></sup> which has been recorded as the sixth largest diaspora in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-:3_541-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:3-541">[537]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Urbanisation">Urbanisation</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Urbanisation_in_Pakistan" title="Urbanisation in Pakistan">Urbanisation in Pakistan</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Kalma_Underpass1.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/Kalma_Underpass1.jpg/220px-Kalma_Underpass1.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/Kalma_Underpass1.jpg/330px-Kalma_Underpass1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/Kalma_Underpass1.jpg/440px-Kalma_Underpass1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="679" data-file-height="450"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Kalma_Underpass1.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Kalma_Underpass" title="Kalma Underpass">Kalma Underpass</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lahore" title="Lahore">Lahore</a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Since <a href="/wiki/Independence_of_Pakistan" class="mw-redirect" title="Independence of Pakistan">achieving independence</a> as a result of the <a href="/wiki/Partition_of_India" title="Partition of India">partition of India</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Urbanisation_in_Pakistan" title="Urbanisation in Pakistan">urbanisation</a> has increased exponentially, with several different causes.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Urban_FrontierâKarachi_518-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Urban_FrontierâKarachi-518">[514]</a></sup> The majority of the population in the south resides along the <a href="/wiki/Indus_River" title="Indus River">Indus River</a>, with <a href="/wiki/Karachi" title="Karachi">Karachi</a> the most populous commercial city.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Urban_FrontierâKarachi_518-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Urban_FrontierâKarachi-518">[514]</a></sup> In the east, west, and north, most of the population lives in an arc formed by the cities of <a href="/wiki/Lahore" title="Lahore">Lahore</a>, <a href="/wiki/Faisalabad" title="Faisalabad">Faisalabad</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rawalpindi" title="Rawalpindi">Rawalpindi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Islamabad" title="Islamabad">Islamabad</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sargodha" title="Sargodha">Sargodha</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gujranwala" title="Gujranwala">Gujranwala</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sialkot" title="Sialkot">Sialkot</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gujrat_city" class="mw-redirect" title="Gujrat city">Gujrat</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jhelum" title="Jhelum">Jhelum</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sheikhupura" title="Sheikhupura">Sheikhupura</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nowshera,_Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa" class="mw-redirect" title="Nowshera, Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa">Nowshera</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mardan" title="Mardan">Mardan</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Peshawar" title="Peshawar">Peshawar</a>. During the period 1990â2008, city dwellers made up 36% of Pakistan's population, making it the most urbanised nation in South Asia. Furthermore, more than 50% of Pakistanis live in towns of 5,000 people or more.<sup id="cite_ref-Jason_Burke_520-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jason_Burke-520">[516]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Immigration_to_Pakistan" title="Immigration to Pakistan">Immigration</a>, from both within and outside the country, is regarded as one of the main factors contributing to urbanisation in Pakistan. One analysis of the <a href="/wiki/1998_Pakistan_Census" class="mw-redirect" title="1998 Pakistan Census">1998 national census</a> highlighted the significance of the <a href="/wiki/Partition_of_India" title="Partition of India">partition of India</a> in the 1940s as it relates to urban change in Pakistan.<sup id="cite_ref-Clark_542-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clark-542">[538]</a></sup> During and after the independence period, <a href="/wiki/Muhajir_people" title="Muhajir people">Urdu speaking Muslims</a> from India migrated in large numbers to Pakistan, especially to the port city of <a href="/wiki/Karachi" title="Karachi">Karachi</a>, which is today the largest metropolis in Pakistan.<sup id="cite_ref-Clark_542-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clark-542">[538]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Immigration_to_Pakistan" title="Immigration to Pakistan">Migration from other countries</a>, mainly from those nearby, has further accelerated the process of urbanisation in Pakistani cities. Inevitably, the rapid urbanisation caused by these large population movements has also created new political and socio-economic challenges.<sup id="cite_ref-Clark_542-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clark-542">[538]</a></sup> In addition to immigration, economic trends such as the green revolution and political developments, among a host of other factors, are also important causes of urbanisation.<sup id="cite_ref-Clark_542-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clark-542">[538]</a></sup> </p> 
      <table class="navbox"> 
       <tbody>
        <tr>
